thread.title: Post-Gazette Athletes of the Week: Neal McDermott and Daeja Quick
thread.title_full: Post-Gazette Athletes of the Week: Neal McDermott and Daeja Quick

title: Post-Gazette Athletes of the Week: Neal McDermott and Daeja Quick
text:
Post-Gazette Athletes of the Week: Neal McDermott and Daeja Quick February 10, 2017 12:00 AM Neal McDermott 
Neal McDermott, Greensburg Central Catholic 
Last week: McDermott scored 19 points as Greensburg Central Catholic defeated Seton-LaSalle last Thursday. 
Check this out: Greensburg Central Catholic is 19-0 and the only undefeated team in WPIAL boys basketball. McDermott, a 6-foot-3, 185-pound senior guard-forward, has played a huge role in the Centurions’ success, averaging 20 points a game. This comes after a junior season in which McDermott averaged only 11. McDermott is a two-sport standout. In baseball, he is a pitcher-outfielder who helped Greensburg C.C. make it to a WPIAL title game the past two seasons, winning once. McDermott has signed to play baseball at Seton Hill. 
Why so much more scoring from you this season? I think it’s just the way the offense works. I like getting out and running, and our fastbreak is the main part of our offense. Getting in better shape was key, too. But I think I’m looking to attack more often on offense and just looking to score more. 
Be honest. Did you guys really think you’d be unbeaten at this time of year? We have high expectations every year. But being undefeated is pretty surreal. 
Anything at all that has been key to this perfect run? From the beginning of the year, I think we all bought into the program and we have great team chemistry. We have four senior starters who have been playing together since our freshman year and our sophomore point guard, Asa Klimchock, has fit right in. We’ve all trusted the coaching staff and I think that’s big. You have to build some bonds with each other. 
Do you really know how good you guys are yet? We know we’re good, but we have goals to be even better. 
Who is the best basketball-baseball athlete you ever heard of? That’s tough, but I’d say Bo Jackson. 
You know who he is, huh? I know a little sports history here and there. 
Thoughts on Andrew McCutchen to right field? I’m all for it. It’s a sign of a team player. Plus, Starling Marte has won a Gold Glove. So it seems like an obvious move. 
Like or dislike this Super Bowl? The Patriots winning is not my favorite, but you have to really respect Tom Brady. 
People might be surprised to know ... I used to have a buzzcut all the time. Now I’ve let my hair grow. — By Mike White Daeja Quick, Cornell Last week: Quick scored a game-high 20 points to lead Cornell to a 56-48 win against Quigley Catholic, ending the Spartans’ 66-game section winning streak. Monday, Quick scored 22 points to help Cornell claim a share of its first section title by beating Sewickley Academy, 45-34. 
Check this out: Quick, a 5-foot-5 senior guard, is the leading scorer in Class 1A and ranks among the top scorers in the WPIAL with 22.5 points per game. She’s also a menace defensively, averaging 7.1 steals a game. She has four double-doubles and had her first triple-double (16 points, 10 steals, 10 assists) a few weeks ago. Quick began her career at Moon before transferring to Cornell midway through her junior year. She surpassed 1,000 career points last month. 
Your last name is Quick. Quickness is one of your greatest assets, too, right? Essentially, because our team is based on speed. That’s just the game we play. We use speed to win games. 
What does it mean to win the section title? It means so much to our program and our school because every year we break history. This year it means the most because we worked so hard and the first day of practice we said our goal was to get a banner in our gym finally. 
One reason your team can win a WPIAL title? We just want it. We’re working hard for it. We have experience. We want to be the team to hang a WPIAL banner in the gym and have a medal around our neck. It’s about desire and hard work. 
You score the winning points in the WPIAL championship. How would you want to score them? I’m really not a flashy person. If it’s a free throw, that’s great. If it’s a 3-pointer, that’s great. Whatever it takes. 
Best player you have faced this season? [Winchester Thurston’s] Gia Thorpe. 
Did you watch the Super Bowl? Yes. 
Happy with the outcome? I don’t watch much football. I only watch the Super Bowl. I like the underdog more than the team that wins all the time. But I like how the Patriots fought back and won. It was an amazing comeback. 
Tom Brady is … a hard worker. 
One movie you would recommend people watch? My favorite movie is Love and Basketball. — By Brad Everett
